alert.note: Alert for Brown; Cherry; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 25 at 3:03AM CDT until July 25 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Cherry County in north central Nebraska... Northern Rock County in north central Nebraska... Northern Brown County in north central Nebraska... Keya Paha County in north central Nebraska... * Until 400 AM CDT. * At 302 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles southwest of Norden, or 17 miles east of Valentine, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Bassett, Springview, Newport, Norden, Burton, Nets Peak, Bobcat State Wildlife Management Area, Meadville, North River Trail, Sparks, Keller Park State Recreation Area, Thomas Creek State Wildlife Management Area, Mariaville, Smith Falls State Park, Pine Glen State Wildlife Refuge, Antelope Peak, Mills and Brocksburg. This includes the following highways... Highway 183 between mile markers 180 and 182, and between mile markers 196 and 225. Highway 20 between mile markers 208 and 219, and between mile markers 253 and 272. Highway 12 between mile markers 12 and 85. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
